title.narrative: SSC in Statistics between DK and Morocco, I

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Statistics is a peer-to-peer cooperation between Statistics Denmark and the Moroccan national statistical body. Through the project, the Moroccan national statistical body will improve access to relevant statistics, with focus on essential issues within digital data transformation, quality of statistics, monitoring and reporting of the UN Sustainable Development Goals and informed decision-making.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on statistics in Morocco aims to contribute to statistical framework conditions that support informed decision making, improve public debate in Morocco and provide the society with relevant and easily accessible statistics by supporting a:
-strengthened user orientation to better understand user needs and improve user-friendliness and accessibility so more data is used by different levels of society -digital data transformation with the aim to improve quality of statistics and increase efficiency of the statistics production -Improved monitoring and reporting of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
